author: Chauncey Isom
comment: The app often freezes, especially after zooming in on text.

author: Juan Ramos
comment: I just subscribed to their service. The app is useless since it crashes upon opening. I don't want to use the website. Does anybody know if this app will be fixed soon. I really enjoy reading the news via apps.

author: John Blankfort
comment: Brand new install on a Moto X4 with Oreo and it just crashes once you log in as a subscriber.  The app never was great, but now it's totally useless.

author: Alex Mohtashem
comment: Horrible app. Constantly crashes. Can't even read an article once before it forces me to close.

author: Mike Gushard
comment: Seems to crash over and over. I have a paid subscription and may cancel.

author: Matt Murphy
comment: Essential information, but the user interface is very clunky and runs poorly on my low-end HTC.

author: Gary Rainville
comment: Great for California and national news and they seem to have fixed the bugs that previously prompted me to give it a 3 star review.

author: luca lazzarin
comment: Keeps crashing

author: J Sanders
comment: Crashes

author: Wesly Moore
comment: I appreciate the effort to provide quality local journalism. But the app itself is largely useless as headline notifications don't work. Touch notification to read article is still ridiculously inconsistent. Sometimes it works, mostly it takes me to an article I read much earlier. What's the point of notifications if all they do in the end is let me know there's an interesting article that I'll have to search for? LG G4, Nexus 7.

reply.author: tronc Inc.
reply.content: Wesley, thanks for your feedback. In the latest version of the app, we've changed it so that push notifications will take you to the story. You can also add the pushed story to your saved list.

author: William Biggs
comment: It worked for a little while. Now, all it does is crash. The app is horrendous and I keep sending error logs. So far, no response and I'm probably cancelling my subscription because of it.

author: Gary McCarter
comment: Gltchy unresponsive and a general pita. And what's with the portrait only orientation?

author: John Stickel
comment: Slow to load, useless categories with multiple duplicate stories,  sections that go a month without updates.

author: Joseph Reynolds
comment: Sluggish and terrible copy paste controls. I want to read and share your news but the app is making it difficult

author: Timothy Howard
comment: Good Times content, but crashes after opening 5-10 articles.
Crashes constantly on my Pixel 2. Ready to cancel my subscription

author: Jay Yarm
comment: Won't load at all on my Pixel XL. I get the splash screen and then the app dies. I have an online subscription so I'll just continue to read in a browser

author: Christopher Pollock
comment: Crashes on launch 100% of the time.

author: Mike McLaughlin
comment: It's saving trees. 😊

author: Matt Moreno
comment: Embrassed to live in LA. see the wall street journal app. This is too slow. The tiles are too big. I like the enewspaper.

author: DICHRISTA JOHNSON
comment: I have a subscription, I was able to read unlimited articles on the app. Now I have to pay for an additional subscription. Is LAT, crazy? They must be if they think I'm paying them more money.

author: Bill Gervasi
comment: What did you guys do to this app? It slowed this week to unusable speed. It halts for 30 seconds or more to load ads.

author: Vickie Burns-Sikora
comment: I use it on my phone, where is is a great source for everything that happened on the East Coast while I was still asleep.  Also good for breaking news.

author: Janine Roach
comment: Half the time I open the app it tells me I haven't subscribed and I only have one article left this month. Then I hit the back button a few times and it suddenly remembers my log in. Annoying

author: Adele Smith
comment: Unfortunately the app stalls at every story. It is difficult to read through headlines when they pause. I am considering removing my online subscription due to these issues.

author: Jonathan Handel
comment: No landscape mode! That makes it almost useless for tablets.

author: Cheryl Tate
comment: This app is new to me but I enjoy reading especially the local newspaper so it's nice that it's accessible

author: Shawn Lancaster
comment: Way too slow and buggy. Slows down entire phone. Resource hog.

author: Thad Degroot
comment: The app is representative of the Los Angeles Times itself; one of the most important and best written newspapers on the planet.

author: Ben Bergen
comment: I am a paid subscriber. I still get trick adds all the tme.

author: Jonathan Hernandez
comment: Slow, but overall ok.

author: Muriel Brunet
comment: It won't let me quote from articles and clicking on a link inside the article just puts me on a loop where the article I'm reading is just loaded for me again.

author: Scott McCourtney
comment: It's good but not as good as the physical paper.

author: Harvey Lesser
comment: Too many stories are missing their text
Too slow

author: Brent Richards
comment: For the last couple of months the app has been unable to recognize my subscription. At first if I logged out and sign back in it would work but now that does not even work and the only way I can use it is to pay again. In addition it is very slow and bogs down

author: Slash UsrBin
comment: Way too many ads which are too intrusive, and the app forces portrait mode, and it's so so so slow. All I can figure is the LA Times has some of the worst app developers.  NYT app is much better.

author: Johnny Baby
comment: Poor design :  difficult to navigate, looks old - layout is unattractive as well as not intuitive. App is constantly crashing. Is this best LA times can do?

author: David Rodriguez
comment: I like that I can get my news. However, why is this app using so much battery power? It has used 20% of my battery since my last charge. And I've used it for 0 minutes.

author: Adil Karamally
comment: Great news & okay navigation but recent trend of PUSHING ADS while interrupting my reading the news is very tacky. Not worth the irritation. I'm exploring NYT
